rules: Rule1: Either a scientist discovered a material, or a researcher is recognized by the community.
Rule2: Under the condition that a paper is influential, it follows that the paper was accepted by a journal.
Rule3: Either a material was analyzed in a lab, or it is not the case that a scientist discovered a material.
Rule4: Provided that results were published in a journal, it follows that a material was not analyzed in a lab.
Rule5: Whenever results are peer reviewed, it follows that the results were published in a journal.
Rule6: If results are groundbreaking, then a researcher is recognized by the community.
Rule7: Either a paper was retracted, or it is not the case that a study has flawed methodology.
Rule8: In the event that a paper was accepted by a journal, the paper was not retracted.
Rule9: On the condition that a paper was cited by a researcher, the paper was accepted by a journal.
Rule10: If it is not the case that either a paper was cited by a researcher or a paper is influential, then the paper is controversial.
Rule11: Assuming that results are not groundbreaking, it follows that a study has flawed methodology.
facts: Fact2: It is not the case that a paper is controversial.
